quantities.si

This module defines the SI units and prefixes.

All the quantities and units defined in this module store a value of type real intenally. So the predefined parsers can only parse real values.

Authors:
Nicolas Sicard

License:
www.boost.org/LICENSE_1_0.txt, Boost License 1.0

Standards:
http://www.bipm.org/en/si/si_brochure/

Source:
https://github.com/biozic/quantities

alias Dimensionless = quantities.base.Quantity!real.Quantity;
The type of dimensionless quantities

alias yotta = quantities.base.prefix!1e+24.prefix(Q)(Q base) if (isQuantity!Q);
alias zetta = quantities.base.prefix!1e+21.prefix(Q)(Q base) if (isQuantity!Q);

SI prefixes.

alias parseSI = quantities.parsing.rtQuantityParser!(real, siSymbolList).rtQuantityParser(Q, S)(S str) if (isQuantity!Q);
Creates a function that parses a string for a SI unit or quantity at runtime.

Examples:
auto t = parseSI!Time("90 min");
assert(t == 90 * minute);
t = parseSI!Time("h");
assert(t == 1 * hour);


alias si = quantities.parsing.ctQuantityParser!(real, SymbolList(["m":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["L":1]), "kg":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["M":1]), "s":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["T":1]), "A":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["I":1]), "K":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["\xce\x98":1]), "mol":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["N":1]), "cd":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["J":1]), "rad":RTQuantity(1.00000L, null), "sr":RTQuantity(1.00000L, null), "Hz":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["T":-1]), "N":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["L":1, "M":1, "T":-2]), "Pa":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["L":-1, "M":1, "T":-2]), "J":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["L":2, "M":1, "T":-2]), "W":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["L":2, "M":1, "T":-3]), "C":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["T":1, "I":1]), "V":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["L":2, "M":1, "T":-3, "I":-1]), "F":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["L":-2, "M":-1, "T":4, "I":2]), "\xce\xa9":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["L":2, "M":1, "T":-3, "I":-2]), "S":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["L":-2, "M":-1, "T":3, "I":2]), "Wb":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["L":2, "M":1, "T":-2, "I":-1]), "T":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["M":1, "T":-2, "I":-1]), "H":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["L":2, "M":1, "T":-2, "I":-2]), "lm":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["J":1]), "lx":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["L":-2, "J":1]), "Bq":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["T":-1]), "Gy":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["L":2, "T":-2]), "Sv":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["L":2, "T":-2]), "kat":RTQuantity(1.00000L, ["T":-1, "N":1]), "g":RTQuantity(0.001L, ["M":1]), "min":RTQuantity(60.0000L, ["T":1]), "h":RTQuantity(3600.00L, ["T":1]), "d":RTQuantity(86400.0L, ["T":1]), "l":RTQuantity(0.001L, ["L":3]), "L":RTQuantity(0.001L, ["L":3]), "t":RTQuantity(1000.00L, ["M":1]), "eV":RTQuantity(0xb.d26d07a626ec67ep-66L, ["L":2, "M":1, "T":-2]), "Da":RTQuantity(0x8.38fbab4ccff329fp-92L, ["M":1])], ["Y":1e+24L, "Z":1e+21L, "E":1.00000e+18L, "P":1.00000e+15L, "T":1.00000e+12L, "G":1.00000e+09L, "M":1.00000e+06L, "k":1000.00L, "h":100.000L, "da":10.0000L, "d":0.1L, "c":0.01L, "m":0.001L, "\xc2\xb5":1e-06L, "n":1e-09L, "p":1e-12L, "f":1e-15L, "a":1e-18L, "z":1e-21L, "y":1e-24L, "Yi":0x8p+77L, "Zi":0x8p+67L, "Ei":0x8.p+57L, "Pi":0x8.p+47L, "Ti":0x8.p+37L, "Gi":0x8.p+27L, "Mi":0x8.p+17L, "Ki":1024.00L], 2LU), parse, 1.00000L).ctQuantityParser(string str);
Creates a function that parses a string for a SI unit or quantity at compile-time.

Examples:
enum min = si!"min";
enum inch = si!"2.54 cm";

auto conc = si!"1 Âµmol/L";
auto speed = si!"m s^-1";
auto value = si!"0.5";

static assert(is(typeof(conc) == Concentration));
static assert(is(typeof(speed) == Speed));
static assert(is(typeof(value) == Dimensionless));


alias withAllSI = TList;
Helper template that can be used to add all SI units and prefixes when building a symbol list with makeSymbolList.

Time fromDuration(Duration d);
Duration toDuration(Q)(Q quantity) if (isQuantity!Q);
Converts a quantity of time to or from a core.time.Duration

Examples:
auto d = 4.dur!"msecs";
auto t = fromDuration(d);
assert(t.value(milli(second)).approxEqual(4));

auto t2 = 3.5 * minute;
auto d2 = t2.toDuration;
assert(d2.get!"minutes" == 3 && d2.get!"seconds" == 30);
